title: lucia:_lotus_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Lucia (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Lotus can be identified by [[red eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[gradient hair|gradient hair colour]] (red tips to black roots), [[double-parted bangs]], [[hair between eyes]] and two [[low-tied sidelocks]]. She wears a [[red scarf]], a [[black shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] (that exposes a [[midriff]] depending on awakening level), a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[black pantyhose]] or [[black thighhighs|black]]/[[red thighhighs|red thighhigh]] depending on awakening level.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[lucia: lotus (gray feathers: lotus) (punishing: gray raven)|Gray Feathers: Lotus]]
* [[lucia: lotus (daybreak) (pgr)|Daybreak]]
* [[lucia: lotus (rain walking) (pgr)|Rain Walking]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Lucia: Lotus Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Lucia:_Lotus/Gallery]

body: [[Official alternate costume]] for [[Selena: Tempest (pgr)|]].

title: lucia:_lotus_(rain_walking)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Lucia (pgr)|]]'s [[lucia: lotus (pgr)|Lotus frame]].

The Rain Walking coating retains all the hair features that of the Lotus frame except for the low tied sidelocks being replaced, [[red eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[double-parted bangs]]. The coating has a set of new [[headgear]]s which projects two short [[holographic horns|holographic]] [[red horns]], [[doll joints]] can be seen on her knee, wrist and finger joints.

Her outfit consist of two layers. Inner layer is a [[black dress|black]] and [[red dress|red]] [[short dress]] with a [[v-neck]] design and [[gradient sleeves|gradient]] [[long sleeves]]. Outer layer is a [[see-through jacket]] (or [[raincoat]]) with a noticeably big [[zipper pull tab]] and the Gray Raven [[emblem]] printed on the back. No clothing on her lower body except for her [[black footwear|black]] and [[red footwear]].

title: noan:_arca_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Noan (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], [[cyborg]] in appearance.

h4. Appearance
[[short_hair|Short]] [[grey hair|dark grey hair]] with [[streaked hair|white streaks]] and [[yellow eyes]], he wears a pair of [[glasses]] with a [[semi-rimless eyewear|half rimmed]] design. Right arm is [[bandaged arm|bandaged]] while his left arm is [[mechanical arms|mechanical]], exposed [[mechabare]] and augments on his torso and neck making up the cyborg appearance. Uses Rev Blades (set of two [[sword]]s, one [[long sword|long]] and one [[short sword|short]]) as weapons.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[noan: arca (homecoming) (pgr)|Homecoming]]

title: haicma:_starveil_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Haicma (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], [[cyborg]] in appearance.

h4. Appearance
Haicma's Starveil frame is entirely [[mechabare|mechanical]], but it is far more streamlined and can look similar to wearing a [[skin tight]] black/grey [[bodysuit]]. She has [[white hair]] in the style of [[short hair with long locks]], [[parted bangs]] and a [[single hair bun]]. [[Yellow eyes]] with four [[mole under eye|moles under eyes]]. All four of her limbs are mechanical, showing obvious [[robot joints|robotic joints]] at her elbow and wrist on her [[mechanical arms]] and [[mechanical hands]]. Her [[mechanical foot|feet]] is unusual, the ground contacting area is very small, giving off the impression as if she is standing/walking on [[tiptoes]] but with no digits present, possibly eligible for [[fewer digits]] or [[ballet boots]] tag.

Her outfit is a [[white dress|white]] [[strapless dress]] with [[side slit]]s on both sides similar to a [[china dress]], the dress itself is also skin tight (eligible for [[impossible dress]]) to a state where her [[covered navel]] and [[ribs]] can be partially seen under the fabrics, the bottom part of her dress turns partially [[see-through clothes|transparent]]. She is sometimes depicted with a white [[bonnet]] hat with electrical [[cable]]s attached near the rear. Two [[hairclip]]s can be found on her left sidelock above her left eye.

She uses a [[huge weapon|large]] [[scythe]] as her [[polearm]] weapon. Is occasionally depicted with [[blue butterfly|blue butterflies]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[haicma: starveil (fantastical fellowship) (pgr)|Fantastical Fellowship]]

h4. External link
* "GrayRavens wiki - Haicma: Starveil Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Haicma:_Starveil/Gallery]

body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Lucia: Lotus (pgr)|]], she has the same physical characteristics as Lotus.

h4. Apparel
Daybreak coating consist of a [[high collar]] [[red bodysuit]] that exposes her [[underboob]], wearing a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow high]] [[fingerless gloves]]. Also fitted with metallic [[knee pads]].

title: pulao:_dragontoll_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Pulao (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Short and [[petite]], Dragontoll is the playable version of Pulao, she has [[black hair]] and [[red eyes]], her sidelocks are tied into two [[hair rings]], she has a [[one side up]] on the left tied by a [[lantern hair ornament|lantern]], and the overall length of her hair is [[long hair|long]], usually depicted with a [[ahoge]]. Both of her arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]].

Her clothing element consist of two pieces. A [[white]] [[cropped jacket]] with a [[calligraphy]] character '蒲'  written on the back, and has [[cloud print]]. And a [[black dress|black]] (or [[brown dress|brown]]) [[backless dress|backless]] [[short dress]], the dress itself has [[side slit]]s on both sides and a [[Chinese knot]] on the left side, under the side slits her [[lowleg panties|lowleg]] [[white panties]] are visible. She wears either a [[black footwear|black]] or [[white footwear|white]] [[thigh boots]].

She uses [[martial arts]] in combat but also wields a [[floating weapon|floating]] [[dao]] (if depicted properly) as a weapon, the dao itself is bigger than Pulao ([[huge weapon]]). Her NPC appearance has the cropped jacket being replaced by a [[white cape]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[pulao: dragontoll (dragonwood) (pgr)|Dragonwood]]
* [[pulao: dragontoll (dreamweaver) (pgr)|Dreamweaver]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Pulao: Dragontoll Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Pulao:_Dragontoll/Gallery]

title: karenina:_ember_(silver_white)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Karenina (pgr)|]]'s [[karenina: ember (pgr)|Ember frame]].

Released as part of the Oathbound series, the Silver White coating has the exact same hair style as the default Ember coating, keeping her [[white hair]] styled with [[twin drills]], has a pair of ball shaped and [[heart hair ornament]]s attached on her drills. She retains her [[yellow eyes|yellow]]/[[orange eyes]], mechanical elements of her body includes [[mechanical legs]].

The outfit itself is a [[white dress|white]] [[halter dress]], where the neckpiece is a piece of reflective fabric similar to the default Ember frame, the dress itself also has a [[see-through cape|see-through]] [[waist cape]]. The outfit also came with [[long sleeves|long]] [[puffy detached sleeves]] and [[black gloves|black]] [[partially fingerless gloves]].

title: karenina:_blast_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Karenina (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Karenina's Blast frame has [[white hair|white]]/[[blonde hair|blonde]] [[short hair with long locks]], with [[swept bangs]] and [[orange eyes]]. She has [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[mechanical]] [[cat ears]] on her head, typically hidden beneath her [[hood]]. 

Blast frame's Apparels include a [[black unitard|black]] [[unitard]], a [[black jacket|black]] [[hooded jacket]] with orange inner linings. The hood itself has a pair of [[large horns]] making it a [[horned hood]]. She is [[bare legs|bare legged]], wearing nothing on her lower body except for [[black footwear]]. Other apparels includes [[dog tags]] and an [[orange armband]]. She can be depicted [[hood down]], with a [[black scarf]] and her unitard replaced with [[black shorts]] and a [[black sports bra]], depending on awakening level. Carries a large [[cannon]] barrel as her weapon.

There is an alternative design of Blast, where the bodysuit has a large central [[argyle cutout|argyle]] [[clothing cutout|cutout]] exposing [[underboob]], [[stomach]] and [[navel]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[karenina: blast (gray feathers: blast) (punishing: gray raven)|Gray Feathers: Blast]]
* [[karenina: blast (crack n blast) (pgr)|Crack 'n Blast]]

* "GrayRavens wiki - Karenina: Blast Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Karenina:_Blast/Gallery]

title: lucia:_plume_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Lucia (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Plume is identified by her [[red eyes]], two [[mechanical arms|mechanical forearms]], two [[mechanical legs]] fitted up to mid thighs. She has [[long hair]] in the form of [[twintails]], which are [[multicolored hair|multicolored]] [[gradient hair]], from red tips to black roots. Also has [[sidelocks]] and [[hair between eyes|bangs between eyes]]. Apparels include [[fake horns]], mechanical [[arm guards]] on both arms, a large [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[black jacket]] with red linings, inside is a [[black dress]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[lucia: plume (eventide glow) (pgr)|Eventide Glow]]

title: vera:_rozen_(agony_break)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Vera (pgr)|]]'s [[vera: rozen (pgr)|Rozen frame]].

A [[nurse]] themed [[halloween costume]] for the Rozen frame, highly mechanical in appearance with the left arm ([[single mechanical arm]]) and both legs as [[mechanical legs|mechanical]]. Keeping her [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair]] but hair colour is now [[gradient hair|gradient]] with [[red hair|red]] roots to [[white hair|white]] tips, [[parted hair|hair parts]] into two halves at the lower end. Left eye is [[one eye covered|covered]] by a [[medical eyepatch]], but blood can be seen dripping down ([[blood from eyes]], [[blood on face]]). Wears a [[nurse cap]] and a [[white ribbon|white]] [[hair ribbon]] on the back.

The outfit is a [[blood on clothes|blood stained]] [[torn bodysuit|torn]] [[backless bodysuit|backless]] [[white bodysuit]], no clothing on the lower body except for the [[bandaged leg|bandaged right leg]]. Left sleeve is [[torn sleeve|torned]] and exposes the mechanical arm, sleeves has puffy shoulders ([[juliet sleeves]]). A [[blood bag]] is taped on to her stomach, a pair of [[surgical scissors]], a [[scalpel]] and a [[syringe]] are taped to her right forearm.

title: rosetta:_rigor_(niki_us1000)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Rosetta (pgr)|]]'s [[Rosetta: Rigor (pgr)|Rigor frame]].

While still retaining a mostly mechanical body like her default appearance, several elements are changed, Niki is a racing themed coating, her [[cyborg]] body is painted mostly in black white and red, with various [[decal]]s painted on her body. The only biological feature is her head, with a new [[bob cut]] hair style and an orange [[streaked hair|streak]].

title: karenina:_scire_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Karenina (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Karenina has [[yellow eyes|yellow]]/[[orange eyes]] and [[white hair]] with her Scire frame, her hair style has [[twintails]] at the back, [[swept bangs]] and shoulder length [[sidelocks]], overall hair length is [[medium hair|medium]]. The [[mechanical]] [[hair ornament]]s that ties her twintails together can flip upwards and resemble [[fake animal ears]]. All four limbs are mechanical, both of her [[mechanical arms]] connects just above the elbow [[robot joints|joints]], her [[mechanical legs]] are hidden well by her [[thigh boots]], exposing only the mechanical knee joints at the back and [[mechanical foot|mechanical feet]].

The Scire frame has an overall slim appearance with her [[skin tight]] [[black bodysuit|black]] and [[white bodysuit]], the bodysuit itself is of a [[backless bodysuit|backless]] design, with [[armpit cutout]]s. The abdomen section of the bodysuit can be depicted with white fabrics instead, she is also sometimes depicted with [[black pantyhose]] with [[thigh cutout]] design, depending on frame's awakening level.

She uses a transformable [[war hammer]] as her [[huge weapon|weapon]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[karenina: scire (maleficent) (pgr)|Maleficent]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Karenina: Scire Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Karenina:_Scire/Gallery]

title: karenina:_scire_(maleficent)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Karenina (pgr)|]]'s [[karenina: scire (pgr)|Scire frame]]. [[Cyborg]] in appearance.

The Maleficent coating retains much of the physical bodily appearance of the original Scire design with slight additions, [[yellow eyes|yellow]] / [[orange eyes]], her hair style remains to be [[medium hair|medium length]] [[white hair|white]] / [[grey hair]] with [[twintails]], [[swept bangs]], shoulder length [[sidelocks]], adorned with [[hair ornament]] such as [[x hair ornament]] on the left lock, a [[maid headdress]] and two [[scrunchie]] tying the twintails up. All four limbs are mechanical but with a different design, [[mechanical arms]] attaches just above the elbow, [[mechanical hands]] has very sharp fingers and resembles [[claws]], [[mechanical legs]] attaches just above the knee and [[mechanical foot]] has [[high heels]] incorporated into the design. [[robot joints|Robotic (ball shaped) joints]] can be found at the shoulder, elbow, wrist, knee and ankle joint, with the shoulder area exposing some of the internal torso [[mechabare]]. In addition to the mechanical limbs, she has an external skeletal [[mechanical spine]] that extends past her waist and becomes an [[mechanical tail]].

Her outfit consist of a [[white shirt]] with [[vertical-striped shirt|vertical stripes]] with a lower [[back cutout]] and [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] design. A [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]] that cuts off around the higher thigh region, a different shade of fabric is [[patchwork clothes|patched]] onto the left side of the skirt. The non-mechanical section of her thighs wears [[black pantyhose]].

title: rosetta:_rigor_(einherjar)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Rosetta (pgr)|]]'s [[Rosetta: Rigor (pgr)|Rigor frame]].

While still retaining a mostly mechanical body like her default appearance, several elements are changed, almost [[monochrome]] in coloration, the Einherjar coating is almost entirely black and white.

Hair colour is now more [[white hair|white]], center-flap bangs is now simply [[double-parted bangs]], eye colour changed from yellow to [[blue eyes|blue]] with [[horizontal pupils]], as well as the addition of dark brown [[eyeshadow]] makeup.

The Einherjar coating has a single [[mechanical wings|mechanical wings]] mounted on the left shoulder instead of both, the skin of her abdomen section is entirely [[see-through body|translucent]] and her [[mechanical spine]] is visible from the outside.

title: vera:_rozen_(night_fever)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Vera (pgr)|]]'s [[vera: rozen (pgr)|Rozen frame]].

Night Fever coating is a set of new apparels for the Rozen frame, no mechanical bodily features, as well as slight changes to her hair style. She still has [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[red hair]], but the sidelocks are shorter and the hair no longer parts from behind. [[Red eyes]] with [[cross-shaped pupils]] and a [[mole under eye|mole under left eye]]. Left ear has a single [[earpiece]], right ear has a small [[hoop earrings]], headwear is a [[black headwear|black]] [[baseball cap]] with two [[horned headwear|horns]] on the sides and a white [[pom pom (clothes)|]] on top.

Her body clothes consist of a [[fishnet top|fishnet]] [[front-tie top]], a [[black jacket]] typically [[off shoulder|worn hanging off her arms]] with gold trims, a [[front slit]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]] and an [[asymmetrical pants|asymmetrical]] [[black leggings]]. Footwear is a pair of [[high heels|high heeled]] [[spiked boots|spiked]] [[black footwear|black]] [[ankle boots]], right leg has a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[pink thighhighs|pink thighhigh]] with [[star print]]s, the visible areas of the [[single sock|single]] left [[ankle socks]] is depicted [[torn socks|torned]].

title: lucia:_pyroath_(pgr)
body: A Frame of [[Lucia (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

title: wanshi:_hypnos_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Wanshi (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
In the Hypnos frame, Wanshi has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] that is usually [[unkempt]] or [[messy hair|messy]] (possibly [[cowlick]]s), he has [[yellow eyes]] but the left eye is [[one eye covered|covered]] by his [[hair over one eye|hair]]. Wears a [[sleep mask]] on his forehead, he is usually depicted tired, [[sleeping]] and/or has [[bags under eyes]]. Has a single [[mole under mouth]] (left chin) and two [[mechanical legs]] that attaches above the knee.

His apparels consist of a [[black undershirt|black]] [[undershirt]] with a [[white jacket|white]] [[open jacket]], the jacket's [[long sleeves]] can be coated in [[digital camouflage]] depending on awakening level of the character. Wears a pair of [[white pants]], with [[thigh strap]], [[thigh pouch]] and [[belt pouch]]. Other possible accessories including [[dog tags]], [[chest harness]] and a [[walkie-talkie]].

Uses a [[sniper rifle]] as main weapon and a pistol [[handgun]] as side arm.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[wanshi: hypnos (hawk scout) (pgr)|Hawk Scout]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Wanshi: Hypnos Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Wanshi:_Hypnos/Gallery]

title: bianca:_zero_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Bianca (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

Bianca Zero has [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]], the hair style consist of [[double-parted bangs]], [[short hair with long locks|long locks]] and a braided bundle at the back. Other notable appearance tags are [[mole under eye|mole under left eye]] and [[large breasts]]. Though her hair style incorporates [[hair intakes]], it is usually hidden by the headwear.

Her apparel consists of a [[white shirt]], white [[fur trim|fur trimmed]] [[surcoat]], [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt]] and [[black leggings]] with [[argyle legwear|arygle patterns]]. Other notable apparels include [[black gloves]], white [[papakha]], [[high heels]] and [[thigh strap]]s.

Sometimes her outfit is depicted differently, with blue [[hat feather]]s on her papakha, embedded with [[medallion]]s, or the papakha being replaced all together with a [[shako cap]].

h4. See also

* [[bianca: zero (gray feathers: zero) (pgr)|Gray Feathers: Zero]]

h4. External links

* "GrayRavens Wiki: Bianca: Zero":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Bianca:_Zero]

title: chrome:_glory_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Chrome (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
In the Glory frame, Chrome retains his [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]] appearance. Mostly biological in appearance, the only mechanical element on the Glory frame is the device on the back which resembles are pair of small [[mechanical wings]] and the external [[mechanical spine]].

His outfit consist of three layers, inner most is a [[white undershirt]]/[[t-shirt]], mid layer is a [[black jumpsuit]], outermost is a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[black coat]] ([[open coat]]), the coat has [[see-through coat|see-through]] windows near the thigh region, left shoulder has a [[single shoulder pad]]. Wears a pair of black [[gauntlets]] and a pair of [[black gloves]], his [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]] can look like [[armored boots]] as it has armor platings on the front.

Uses a [[gunblade]] as weapon.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[chrome: glory (honor model) (pgr)|Honor Model]]
* [[chrome: glory (nosferatu) (pgr)|Nosferatu]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Chrome: Glory Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Chrome:_Glory/Gallery]

title: bianca:_stigmata_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Bianca (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. The defaut appearance of the Stigmata frame is actually a corroded version of the [[bianca: stigmata (exorcist) (pgr)|Exorcist coating]].

h4. Appearance
In her Stigmata frame her appearance is muted with colours somewhat washed off, she has [[bleached hair|bleached blonde]] / [[grey hair]], [[pale skin]] complexion, [[large breasts]] and dark [[purple eyes]]. Her hair style has a single long [[braided ponytail]], pushing her overall hair length to [[very long hair|very long]], wears a [[circlet]] as hair ornaments has [[hair intakes]]. Has a [[single earring|single]] [[cross earrings|cross earring]] on her left ear and a [[mole under eye|mole under right eye]].

Both of her arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]], left leg is [[mechanical legs|mechanical]], attached just above the knee ([[single mechanical leg]]), [[robot joints]] can be found at her elbow, left knee and ankles. Her body apparels consist of a [[backless bodysuit|backless]] [[black bodysuit]] with [[torn bodystocking]] on her shoulder and neck, the only remaining clothing from the Exorcist coating is an incomplete [[halterneck]] top, where only the front fabrics remain.

She uses a [[greatsword]] ([[zweihander]] if depicted properly) as her [[weapon]], and often seen carrying a mechanical [[lantern]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[bianca: stigmata (exorcist) (pgr)|Exorcist]]
* [[bianca: stigmata (solitary dream) (pgr)|Snow Petals]] <tn>*Name subject to change upon global release</tn>

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Bianca: Stigmata Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Bianca:_Stigmata/Gallery]

title: chrome:_arclight_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Chrome (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
In the Arclight frame, Chrome retains his [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]] appearance, wears a single [[earpiece]] on his left ear.

His apparels consist of a [[bodysuit]] as innerwear ([[bodysuit under clothes]]), and a long [[white robe]] with [[wide sleeves|wide]] and [[long sleeves]] on the outer. His robe has a [[bandolier]] holding various tactical items and his [[dog tags]] attached, as well as having a [[chest protector]] attached, his robe also has the Strike Hawk [[emblem]] printed on the back and on the front left knee region. Footwear is a [[black footwear|black]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots]].

Depending on awakening level, he can be depicted wearing a [[grey scarf]], his bodysuit can look like a [[black undershirt]] when he is depicted in a [[portrait]] / [[upper body]] format. Uses a [[huge weapon|huge]] [[scythe]] as his weapon.

title: sophia:_silverfang_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Sophia (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], [[cyborg]] in appearance.

h4. Appearance
The Silverfang frame is [[petite]] ([[flat chest]]) in body shape, has [[orange eyes]], [[dark skin]] ([[dark-skinned female]]) with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] in a [[bob cut]] style with [[asymmetrical bangs]]. She has [[bags under eyes]] and facial [[freckles]], her hair is adorned with five [[x hair ornament]]s. Both of her arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]], attached on her biceps, she also has two mechanical appendages ([[extra arms]]) from a device attached on her lower back, [[robot joints]] can be seen on her elbow, wrist, and on the extra mechanical arms.

Clothing consist of a [[white bodysuit|white]] [[skintight]] [[bodysuit]] with [[juliet sleeves]] and [[turtleneck]] [[high collar]] design. For legwear she wears a pair of [[toeless legwear|toeless]] [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thighhighs]] with [[no shoes]]. Other apparel elements include: a [[mechabare|mechanical part/device]] attached to her [[chest protector]], [[canister]]s attached to her back device, [[drum magazine]]s attached to the end of her extra mechanical arms. [[Dual wielding|Dual wields]] [[handgun|pistol handguns]] as her weapons.

title: nanami:_pulse_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Nanami (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], [[cyborg]] in appearance.

h4. Appearance
The Pulse frame features [[grey eyes]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]], [[bob cut|bob cut style]] on the front, upswept into a [[high ponytail]] at the back, also featuring [[French braid]]s, tied together by a mechanical tie and a [[hair ornament]]/[[headgear]]. All four limbs are [[mechanical]], [[mechanical arms]] connects above the elbow joint, [[mechanical legs]] connects above the knee, her feet are a pair of [[roller shoes|rollers]] with single wheel drive. She can be depicted carrying a [[spare tire|spare wheel]] on her back depending on awakening level.

Pulse wears a [[grey dress|grey]] and [[black dress|black]] [[multicolored dress|multicolored]] [[off-shoulder dress|off shoulder]] [[armored dress]] featuring a singular [[chest protector|chest protector plate]] and [[polka dot dress|polka]] patterns all over the dress. The dress is suspended by a [[choker]]. A [[yellow dress|yellow]] tertiary color can be introduced to the dress body depending on awakening level, as well as having/lack of [[thigh strap]]s with a [[thigh pouch]].

Uses a [[chainsword]] as her weapon.

title: nanami:_storm_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Nanami (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], [[cyborg]] in appearance.

h4. Appearance
Storm has [[grey eyes|grey eyes]], [[long_hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in a [[bob cut]] style on the front, a [[French braid]] at the back tied up by a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]], and the overall length is [[very long hair|very long]], extending past the waist. Featuring [[mechanical]] elements such as a pair of [[small horns|small]] [[mechanical horns]] on her head, [[mechabare]] protecting face and neck, both arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]] up to the biceps, as well as having mechanical feet.

Storm frame wears a [[black dress|black]] [[print dress]] similar to the YoRHa style, featuring [[patterned clothing|pattern print on skirt]] and [[juliet sleeves]], sometimes depicted as a [[collared dress]] depending on awakening level. Other apparel elements such as [[black pantyhose]] for legwear, and a [[chest harness]] with small [[pouch]]es attached. Outfit elements can include an extra [[belt pouch]], a dress adding a [[corset]], extra [[headgear]] resembling animal ears, fake small horns being replaced by a [[spiked hairband]] and/or multiple [[floating object|floating]] O rings depending on awakening level. Uses a [[chainsword]] as weapon.

Typically depicted with only the left arm being [[mechanical arms|mechanical]] ([[single mechanical arm]]), though depending on awakening level of the frame, both arms can be mechanical.

Apparel consist of several layers, inner-most is a black [[bodysuit]] with [[mechanical]] elements, followed by a dark brown [[waistcoat]], outerwear is a [[brown coat|brown/beige]] [[trench coat]], [[black pants|black suit pants]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. title: fleetway_super_sonic
body: Or simply "[[Super Sonic]]" is the super form that [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]] takes in the comic book series [[Sonic the Comic]]. This form is known more commonly by fans as "Fleetway Super Sonic". Unlike the [[Sonic (series)|video game]] depictions of Super Sonic, this form is a psychotic demon-like entity who manifests himself in Sonic's body under conditions of extreme stress or exposure to chaos energy.

title: bike_shorts
body:
Tight, form-fitting athletic shorts composed of nylon and Spandex that reach about mid-thigh.

The primary purposes of bike shorts are to compress muscles (particularly the groin and thighs), prevent chafing, help remove sweat, keep muscles warm, and keep male genitals in place.  There are two similar appearing types of these, compression shorts and bike shorts. Both types may be used without underwear, depending on if they were designed to act as underwear.

On Danbooru, the most common version depicted are compression shorts, which are used for a variety of sports and athletic activities.  Compression shorts are similar to bike shorts, but aren't designed with biking in mind and thus lack things like padding to reduce discomfort from long rides. Compression shorts are sometimes used by some women to conceal their [[panties]] beneath their [[skirt]], especially for those in women's sports where their uniform has a skirt, such as [[field hockey]] or [[lacrosse]]. 

In some places, these are known as spats for some reason. If you were searching for the Jazz Age footwear, go to [[spats (footwear)]].

h4. Types

* [[Bib shorts]]

h4. See also 

* [[Compression sleeve]]
* [[Shorts]] 
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

body:
The Mourning Aix is an enemy boss encountered in [[Wuthering Waves]], an Overlord-class Spectro elemental [[Tacet Discord (Wuthering Waves)|]], and the central focus of the exploration questline of the Whinning Aix's Mire.

A flight capable TD, Mourning Aix has a bird-like head, Eastern dragon-like body, two pairs of wings, and two forearms with human-like hands. Has purple body, feathers with white feather wings, certain body part glows gold.

title: irn-bru
body:
Originally Iron Brew, this is a [[Scotland|Scottish]] [[soda]] that is described as "Scotland's other national drink" after [[Scotch whisky]]. Glasgow-based A.G. Barr manufactures the drink, first introduced in 1901. It has long been the most popular soda in Scotland ahead of the likes of [[Coca-Cola]], [[Pepsi]] and [[Fanta]] and is also sold elsewhere in the United Kingdom. In addition, it can also be found internationally in areas where there is a sizable Scottish community.

h4. Related Links

* "Official website":[https://irn-bru.co.uk/]
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irn-Bru]

title: we_live_in_a_society_social_media_reactions_(meme)
body:
"We Live In a Society Social Media Reactions" refers to a series of images that juxtapose a popular item with a complex but underappreciated one, using photoshopped social media reactions to highlight the disparity.
This format first appeared on May 12th, 2018, when Twitter user 660th posted an image of [[Mickey Mouse]] with positive reactions next to a detailed illustration of a mouse with no reactions, captioned "We live in a society".

Note that this meme is unrelated to the [[We Live in a Society_(meme)|]] meme that involves the [[Joker_(dc)|]] and an usually more "edgy" theme.

h4. Original
* !asset #23224283
h4. External Links:
* "Twitter: @660th: We live in a society (archived)":[https://web.archive.org/web/20180515014633/https://twitter.com/660th/status/995384248440942592]
* "KnowYourMeme: We Live In a Society Social Media Reactions":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/we-live-in-a-society-social-media-reactions]

title: eddie_brock
body: Edward "Eddie" Charles Allan Brock is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. The character was created by David Michelinie and Todd McFarlane, making a cameo appearance in Web of [[Spider-Man (series)|Spider-Man]] #18 (September 1986), before making his first full appearance in The Amazing Spider-Man #300 (May 1988) as the most well-known host of the [[venom (marvel)|Venom]] symbiote.

title: venom_(marvel)
body:
A shapeshifting villain/anti-hero from the [[Spider-Man (series)|]] series of comic books published by [[Marvel]].

Venom is an alien symbiote that initially attaches itself to [[Peter Parker]], leading to the creation of the Symbiote Suit (or the black Spider-Man suit). However, the power boost granted by the alien entity proves to corrupt Peter's mind, and he rids himself of it - leading the scorned creature to take over Parker's rival, [[Eddie Brock]], and swear revenge, eventually settling into the role of an anti-hero.

The symbiote was first introduced as Spider-Man's new black costume in The Amazing Spider-Man #252 (May 1984) as part of a story called "Homecoming!" The story takes place after Spider-Man's return from the events of the miniseries Secret Wars, where he first obtains the black costume. The full first appearance of Venom is in The Amazing Spider-Man #300 (May 1988), after the symbiote bonds with Eddie Brock.

title: transparent
body:
An object other than clothing that actually, physically allows some amount of light to pass through it. If a normally opaque object such as a wooden desk is rendered partly invisible by artistic fiat, that's [[x-ray]].

If some article of clothing is transparent, use [[see-through clothes]] instead. If a person seems to be disappearing, [[fading]] may be appropriate as well; for a character's skin that's transparent, see [[see-through body]].
h4. See also

* [[blending]]
* [[invisible]]
* [[translucent]]
* [[transparent seat]]
* [[see-through clothes]]
* [[transparent background]]
* [[alpha transparency]]

title: ai-generated_encore_(meme)
body:
Redraws and references to an [[AI-generated art (topic)|AI-generated]] [[Hatsune Miku]] artwork posted by [[pon pon pon ai]]. The image's striking style caused it to go viral, with many artists and fans expressing disappointment upon learning that it was an AI generated image, which in turn sparked a trend of artists redrawing the piece by hand.

h4. Origin

* !asset #23192640: The original [[AI-generated]] piece, with the commentary 「アンコール」 (Encore)

title: rmb-93
body:
A Russian-made [[pump action]] [[shotgun]] manufactured by KBP Instrument Design Bureau. Utilizes slide-action operation called "Inverted Cycle". The feeding tube is placed over the barrel rather than under it, and is accessed through a flip-up cover on the top of the receiver. It is used by the public for hunting and self-defense.

h4. See also

title: chiang_kai-shek
body: A prominent leader of the Republic of [[China]]. After having led the country starting in 1928, he was [[chinese civil war|defeated]] by [[Mao Zedong]]'s communist forces in 1949, from then on serving as the leader of the government-in-exile on [[Taiwan]] until his death in 1975. Known for his charismatic leadership yet his inability suppress the widespread corruption within his country, which led to his eventual downfall on mainland China.

title: clear_sky
body:
A [[sky]] that is nearly or completely devoid of [[cloud|clouds]], regardless of the time of the day.

h4. See also
* [[sun shower]]

title: sunlight
body:
The light of the sun.

[[Sunbeam]] (crepuscular rays) is where light rays stream through gaps in clouds or between other objects. These are columns of sunlit air separated by darker cloud-shadowed regions. (See post #438675)

[[Sunburst]] is for designs or figures of burst of [[sunlight]], but may not necessarily be the actual sun (See post #645306)

For tagging purposes, keep in mind that a particular image may satisfy one or more of the specific terms mentioned above.

h4. See also

* [[dappled sunlight]]
* [[sunbeam]]
* [[sunburst]]
* [[sun shower]]
* [[lens flare]]

h4. External links

* "Dictionary.com: Sunlight":https://dictionary.reference.com/browse/sunlight
* "Wikipedia: Crepuscular rays":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crepuscular_rays

Notably has two names for its associated [[E.G.O (PROJECT MOON)|]]:

title: sun_shower
body:
A meteorological phenomenon in which [[rain]] falls while the [[sunlight|sun is shining]]. It can sometimes occur in a partially [[cloudy sky]] or even in a [[clear sky|clear]] [[blue sky|sky]]. It is usually the result of winds blowing the airborne raindrops into an area where there are no clouds.

One of the possible explanations for one of its Japanese names, 狐の嫁入り ([i]Kitsune no yomeiri[/i]), which literally means "fox's wedding," comes from the old belief that such rains are inexplicable and unnatural. In Japan, foxes (or kitsune) were believed to shapeshift, trick people, or cause them to hallucinate. It was believed that the rain fell to prevent people from seeing a fox wedding procession that took place during the day.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Sunshower":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunshower
* "Wikipedia: Kitsune no yomeiri":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kitsune_no_yomeiri

title: faust_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.02 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named after and based off of the titular character "Faust":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Faust from German folklore, along with her creation [[Mephistopheles (project moon)|]].

She has [[medium hair|medium length]] [[white hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears the uniform of all Limbus Company sinners, consisting of a [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[belt]], [[black pants]] but wears a [[turtleneck sweater]] instead of the standard [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] and a [[torn coat|torn]] [[black coat]] she wears on her [[coat on shoulders|shoulders]]. 

She wields a [[zweihander]] in her base identity with the German word 'WALPURGISNACHT' written on its blade. 

h4. Official art

* !post #5028568

title: bohrok_(bionicle)
body:
A race of insectoid robots who travel in swarms, their purpose is to clean the island of Mata Nui as preparation for his awakening. They come in 6 different breeds, each with their own elemental power.

These include:

[[Tahnok_(bionicle)|]], Bohrok of Fire
[[Gahlok_(bionicle)|]], Bohrok of Water
[[Lehvak_(bionicle)|]], Bohrok of Acid
[[Pahrak_(bionicle)|]], Bohrok of Stone
[[Kohrak_(bionicle)|]], Bohrok of Ice
[[Nuhvok_(bionicle)|]], Bohrok of Earth

They are led by two Queens known as the "Bahrag" named [[Cahdok_(bionicle)|Cahdok]] and [[Gahdok_(bionicle)|Gahdok]].

There also exist and elite group of Bohrok called the Bohrak-Kal who wield a different set of powers.

[[Tahnok-Kal_(bionicle)|]], Bohrok-Kal of Lighting
[[Gahlok-Kal_(bionicle)|]], Bohrok-Kal of Magnetism 
[[Lehvak-Kal_(bionicle)|]], Bohrok-Kal of Vacuum
[[Pahrak-Kal_(bionicle)|]], Bohrok-Kal of Plasma
[[Kohrak-Kal_(bionicle)|]], Bohrok-Kal of Sonic
[[Nuhvok-Kal_(bionicle)|]], Bohrok-Kal of Gravity

title: z46_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the German destroyer Z46. Character designed by [[Kinjo Kuromomo]], voiced by [[Chihara Minori]]. 

In-game, she is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] and [[yellow eyes]], with a [[tattoo]] on her right leg. 

Her default outfit consists of a blue [[beret]], a [i][[Reichsadler|Parteiadler]][/i] [[hair ornament]], a [[sleeveless]] [[blue dress|blue]] [[double-breasted]] [[dress]] with a [[frilled dress|frilled white inner layer]], [[black jacket]], a [[black cape|black-]][[red cape]], and red [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her bridge strapped to her cape, two 128 mm twin gun mounts, and two 37 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, while she uses a [[sword]] as her melee weapon.

[quote]Seeking a night of love, it is always chasing someone around. At first it only showed interest in other Pals, but in recent years even humans have become the target of its debauchery.[/quote]

title: fengguan
body:
A type of traditional Chinese headgear for women. It was worn mainly by noblewomen during the Ming Dynasty for ceremonies or official occasions; it is also worn by brides during weddings¹.

Fengguan means "phoenix crown", a name that originates from its adornments: phoenixes made of inlaid kingfisher feathers, as well as gold dragons, beaded pheasants, pearls and other gemstones. Sometimes they are adorned with decorative wings - called diyi - instead of beads. 

h4. See also
* [[chinese clothes|Chinese clothes]]
* [[tag group:headwear]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Fengguan":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fengguan

h4. Notes
¹ The are several different variations of the fengguan's design, so the design can vary greatly. Traditionally, the number of dragons, pheasants and phoenixes on the hat denoted the wearer's rank.

title: stippling_(texture)
body:
A shading technique, where shadow is applied using dots of varying density. Often done by hand in [[traditional media]], but in digital media, digital brushes can replicate this effect. 

For artwork made up entirely of dots, see [[pointillism]].

For the similar dot-like shapes seen in manga screentones and [[pixel art]], see [[dithering]] instead.

h4. Examples
* !asset #23215628
* !post #8179216


h4. See also
* [[Hatching (texture)]]

h4. External links
"Wikipedia: stippling":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stippling]

title: pointillism
body:
Artwork made up entirely - or almost entirely - out of dots. 

For artwork where only the shading is made up dots, see [[stippling (Texture)|]].

h4. See also
* [[Fine art parody]]
* [[Impressionism]]

title: mizura
body:
One of Japan's oldest hairstyles, worn by [b]men[/b] in the ancient period. It consists of two ponytails, could be long or short, one on either side of the head. These are looped down and back up, each then being secured in place with some sort of wrapping (string, [[hair tie]] or [[hair tubes]]... ). Mizura was worn differently according to social status.

Mizura may be confused with [[shuangyaji]], but this style is for [b]women[/b] & [b]girls[/b], and is often higher up on the head or lower back, being more varying.  

H4. Examples
* !post #7149571
* !post #7945917
* !post #4372604: (Mizura on the upper character.)
* !post #627253
h4. See also
* [[double bun]]
* [[hair rings]]
* [[twintails]]
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

h4. External links
* "A History of Men’s Japanese Clothing and Accessories (by Joshua L. Badgley)":http://www.sengokudaimyo.com/garb/garb.ch04.html
* "Symbolism of Hairstyles in Korea and Japan":https://nirc.nanzan-u.ac.jp/nfile/708

title: shuangyaji
body:
A Chinese women's hairstyle which consists of two [[hair bun]]s, sometimes [[braid|braided]]. It resembles two small coils on the top of the head or beside the forehead; sometimes resembling hair bows made of the person's hair. During the [[Song Dynasty]] in China, it was common for maids and young girls to wear such hairstyle.

Not to be confused with [[mizura]], which is for men.
* !post #3791615
* !post #7711901
* !post #7791361

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: golshi's_grand_adventure_2
body:
A endless runner/shooting game within [[Umamusume: Party Dash]], where you play as [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]], jumping over obstacles and blasting through a horde of robot horse girls to (ostensibly) save [[Mejiro McQueen (umamusume)|]] and dropkick Professor Kale (if he even exists).

Unlike the main game's modern pixel art, Golshi's Grand Adventure 2 is presented in a 8-bit style based on the NES/Famicom.

title: umamusume:_party_dash
body:
A party/action game set in the [[Umamusume]] universe released for [[Nintendo Switch]], [[PlayStation 4]], and [[Steam (platform)|]] worldwide on August 30th 2024.

While it's a licensed Umamusume game, it's also a continuation of the various [[kunio-kun series|Kunio-kun sports games]], being developed by [[Arc System Works]], the current caretakers of many Technos properties. It also features [[Golshi's Grand Adventure 2]], a 8-bit style game within the game.

title: uriko_(baseball)
body:
Beer vendors unique to Japanese [[baseball]]. Usually young women in miniskirts or shorts with [[visor cap]]s, [[backpack]]s with attached spray-guns.

They often wear fluorescent or brightly colored uniforms.

h4. External links

* [https://web.archive.org/web/20230616060936/https://www.bangkokpost.com/world/2590895/speed-demons-the-uriko-beer-vendors-of-japanese-baseball](Speed demons: the 'uriko' beer vendors of Japanese baseball)

title: liangbatou
body: Chinese hairstyle/headdress worn traditionally by [[Manchu clothes|Manchurian]] women during a period of the [[Qing dynasty]] - namely, through the 19th century. The hair is wrapped around a long frame known as a bianfang to create a rigid, wingspan-like shape. The hair is then decorated with flowers and hairpins. h5. Examples * !post #7401728 * !post #7691730 For the larger, more elaborate version of this headdress that came later in history, see the [b][[dalachi_(headdress)|]][/b] tag. H4. See also * [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: hair_flowing_over
body:
Long, flowing hair that is draped over an object, item, or irregular surface in such a way that demonstrates proper observation of hair physics and/or gravity. 

Not to be confused with [[floating hair]], which is hair blowing in the wind, or [[hair spread out]], which is hair spread over a surface.

h4. Examples

* !post #4395413
* !post #7842708
* !post #4356688
* !post #2031541

h4. See also

* [[long hair]]
* [[very long hair]]
* [[absurdly long hair]]
* [[hair spread out]]

title: floating_hair
body:
Hair that is blowing in the [[wind]], floating in midair, or otherwise not being held down by gravity.

Generally does not apply to [[tail]]s or hair that is messy or styled to appear gravity-defying.

Not to be confused with [[hair flowing over]], which is hair draped over a surface, or [[hair spread out]], which is hair spread over a surface, or  [[detached hair]], which is hair magically disconnected from the head.

h4. Examples

* !post #5185453
* !post #5637813

h4. See also

* [[hair floating upwards]]
* [[hair lift]]

body:

May also come with an invitation to perform [[ear cleaning]] with a [[mimikaki]].

* !post #3425141

h4. See also

* [[beckoning]]

title: blocked_senses
body:
The blocked senses tag is to be used in cases where a character in a image is unable to feel/use (part of) their senses.
This tag is meant for the full blocking of senses, where a character really cant feel anything trough magic or a physical/neurological condition.

This tag should not be used in cases where a character is blindfolded and/or has earplugs.
(In these cases the senses are not really blocked, it is more that stimulation is intercepted before it can reach the body)
For those cases please use the tag: [[sensory_deprivation]]

title: sex_pistols_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Guido Mista]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as six very tiny humanoids numbered 1-7 (there is no 4). Each has its own personality, but they all love eating.

The Sex Pistols attach to bullets fired from Mista's [[revolver]], allowing him to change their trajectory and ricochet off of objects freely.

Namesake is the English punk rock band [[Sex Pistols]].
other_names: セックス・ピストルズ

title: how_do_we_tell_him?_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] based on a screenshot of the [[Spongebob Squarepants (series)|]] episode "Dying for Pie" in which [[Mr. Krabs]] and [[squidward_tentacles|Squidward]] contemplate how to tell [[spongebob_squarepants|Spongebob]] that he had eaten an explosive [[pie]] and would die by the end of the day. An edited version has them consider just killing him outright.
h4. External links:
* Know Your Meme: "How Do We Tell Him?":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/how-do-we-tell-him]

title: harem_outfit
body:
A form of clothing usually worn by bellydancers. Thus, the ensemble usually emphasizes a bare [[midriff]] and includes a [[bra]], [[bustier]] or [[tube top]]. There may be [[baggy pants]], [[harem pants]], [[loincloth]] or a long [[skirt]] over the legs, as well as possibly a flowing [[headdress]] or [[veil]] and loose sleeves. Jewelry in the form of [[earrings]], [[bracelet]]s, [[necklace]]s or [[anklet]]s may be present. One or more of these articles may be [[see-through clothes|sheer]].

The [[Dunhuang style]] may be mistaken for/look a lot like harem style clothing. 

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: nazuna_(flower_knight_girl)
body:
English Name: Shepherd's Purse
Birthday: 27th July
Age: Otona-desu.

The mascot and player's assistant in Flower Knight Girl. She serves primarily as the lore guide in the game, as although she is a personification of her namesake flower, she is not a Flower Knight herself.

She has a [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[green ribbon]], with a [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[white dress]] and [[elbow gloves]] with a large [[green bow]] behind that emphasize her [[large breasts]] and a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] skirt that exposes her [[panties]].

Her [[osanai nazuna|younger alter ego]] made her debut as a virtual Youtuber on 27th August 2018, one month after Nazuna's birthday.

title: invisible
body:
When a character is completely transparent and cannot be seen by either the viewer or another character. Their clothes may or may not be invisible as well.

If a character is not fully invisible but instead partially [[transparent]], then tag as [[transparent]]. If clothes are partially transparent, use [[see-through clothes]].

h4. See Also
* [[implied invisibility]]
* [[translucent]]
* [[unusually visible]]
* [[x-ray]]

title: nipples_visible_through_clothing
body: See [[covered nipples]] or [[see-through clothes]].

title: optical_camouflage
body:
A kind of camouflage that create the illusion of invisibility by covering an object with something, typically a cloak in fiction, that projects the scene directly behind that object.

h4. See also

* [[blending]]
* [[double exposure]]
* [[invisible]]
* [[see-through clothes]] or [[transparent]]

title: azuma_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese large cruiser [i]Azuma[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration. 
Character design by [[Kishiyo]], voiced by [[Yasuno Kiyono]]. 

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #3480676.[/tn]

As a shipgirl, Azuma is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[yellow_eyes|golden-colored eyes]], along with animal ears similar to [[takao_(azur_lane)|Takao]] and [[large_breasts|a sizeable bust]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white jacket]] hanging off her shoulders, likely based off Imperial Japanese Navy [[military uniform]]s, a button-up shirt with her [[lace-trimmed bra]] [[see-through clothes|visible past the shirt]], a black [[pleated skirt]], [[black gloves]], and dark-colored [[pantyhose]]. Her personality is similar to [[atago_(azur_lane)|Atago]], being very "onee-san" and gently teasing the Commander. 

Her [[rigging]] is themed to act as a chair for her to sit on, with her three 310 mm triple gun mounts to her sides (two on left, one on right) on bow pieces, as well as two 100 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] to her sides at shoulder level. She also has a reconnaissance seaplane to her lower left, while she uses a [[katana]] as a melee weapon.

h4. Trivia
Azuma is a never-built ship based on one of Japan's Project B-65 proposals. The B-65 project was intended to create a "super-cruiser" meant to replace the aging [[Kongou (Azur Lane)|]]-class battlecruisers and lead the IJN's cruiser squadrons into a planned "Decisive Battle" against the US Navy. Her purpose during such an engagement was to lay down heavy barrages against American heavy cruisers while being resistant to any return fire from them. While extensive design work had been carried out, no ships were laid down as Japan's focus shifted to replacing their extensive carrier losses after the [[battle of Midway]] and materials grew scarce. 

As a reference to World of Warships, as per the collab, Azuma gains an ability based off of the "Demolition Expert" skill, increasing her high explosive damage and chance to set fires. 

h4. Skins
* [[azuma_(lily-white_longing)_(azur_lane)|Lily-White Longing]]
* [[azuma_(soft_voice_of_spring)_(azur_lane)|Soft Voice of Spring]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Design B-65":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Design_B-65_cruiser]

title: castle_of_cagliostro
body:
[i]Lupin III: The Castle of Cagliostro[/i], also known as [i]Rupan Sansei: Kariosutoro no Shiro[/i], is a 1979 Japanese animated comedy-drama crime action film co-written and directed by [[Miyazaki Hayao]] as his feature film debut. 

It is the second feature film featuring Monkey Punch's master thief [[Arsene Lupin III]], from his manga series Lupin III.
 
The film was Miyazaki's first time directing a theatrical feature after having previously worked as an animator for [[Toei Animation]] and TMS Entertainment and directing several shows including [[Lupin III]] and two episodes of [i]Lupin III Part II[/i].

American director [[Steven Spielberg]] considers a car chase sequence in the film as the best animated work of all time.
other_names: ルパン三世カリオストロの城

title: sex_pistols
body: The Sex Pistols are an English punk rock band formed in [[London]] in 1975. Although their initial career lasted just two and a half years, they became one of the most culturally influential acts in popular music. The band initiated the punk movement in the [[United Kingdom]] and inspired many later [[punk]], post-punk and alternative rock musicians, while their clothing and hairstyles were a significant influence on the early punk image.

title: the_who
body: The Who are an English rock band formed in London in 1964. Their classic lineup (1964–1978) consisted of lead vocalist Roger Daltrey, guitarist Pete Townshend, bassist John Entwistle and drummer Keith Moon. They are considered one of the most influential rock bands of the 20th century.

title: mount_kilimanjaro
body:
[b]Mount Kilimanjaro[/b] (/ˌkɪlɪmənˈdʒɑːroʊ/) is a dormant volcano in [[Tanzania]]. With three volcanic cones — Kibo, Mawenzi and Shira — it is the highest mountain in [[Africa]] and the highest single free-standing [[mountain]] above sea level in the world: 5,895 m (19,341 ft) above sea level and 4,900 m (16,100 ft) above its plateau base. It is also the highest [[volcano]] in the Eastern Hemisphere.

Kilimanjaro is the fourth most topographically prominent peak on [[earth_(planet)|Earth]]. It is part of Kilimanjaro National Park and is a major hiking and climbing destination. Because of its shrinking glaciers and ice fields, which are projected to disappear between 2025 and 2035, it has been the subject of many scientific studies.

Place of a pivotal [[mecha]] battle in the [[Zeta Gundam]] science fiction anime series.

title: primrose_field_illusion
body:
The Primrose Field Illusion is an [[optical illusion]] created by Professor Akiyoshi Kitaoka, a Japanese psychologist and expert in visual perception. The illusion features a simple pattern of light green and dark green squares, with primroses (magenta and white) in the corners of the squares.

When viewed, the pattern appears to undulate or wave, creating a sense of motion. This illusion is an example of a peripheral drift illusion, where the brain interprets static visual information as dynamic motion. The Primrose Field Illusion is particularly striking due to its use of color, which enhances the perceived motion.

The illusion works by exploiting the way the brain processes visual information. Our brains are wired to recognize patterns and motion, and the Primrose Field Illusion takes advantage of this by presenting a subtle, gradient-like pattern that our brains interpret as movement. The use of color and the specific arrangement of the squares create a sense of depth and dimensionality, further reinforcing the illusion.

title: hydrangea
body:
A genus of [[flower]]ing plants of the [i]Hydrangeaceae[/i] family, native to southern and eastern Asia. Most species are [[bush|shrubs]], but some are small trees. Commonly called [b]hortensia[/b].

Hydrangeas bear globular or umbrella-shaped clusters of flowers that come out any time from early spring to late autumn in a variety of colors influenced by the pH level of the soil. Commonly depicted in shades of blue, purple, and pink.

In Japan, it is commonly associated with the [[rain]]y season. Its Japanese name is "ajisai" (アジサイ or 紫陽花), which refers specifically to [i]Hydrangea macrophylla[/i], the bigleaf hydrangea.

h4. Examples

title: svt-40
body:
The [b]SVT-40[/b] is a [[World War II]]-era Soviet semi-automatic [[rifle]] chambered in 7.62×54mmR, designed by Sergei Simonov.

Different from its predecessor, the [[SVT-38]], it is visually recognizable by having a pair of perforated metal heat shields that appear longer, covering both gas piston assembly on top and the barrel portion. A [[cleaning rod]] can also be stored underneath the barrel.

title: bio_lab
body:
[[Ragnarok Online]]'s most famous dungeon, added in 2005 in Episode 10.2. Compared to most other dungeons featuring various monsters, the Bio Labs had enemies with names who mirrored the player classes. It also was much more difficult than most of the other dungeons at its level and had valuable drops. All of these factors made the Bio Labs one of the most popular spots to grind for levels and the rare monster cards. 

For tagging purposes, use this when the characters are shown with their characteristic aura (such as post #4320593), or the laboratory ruins are present. 

In 2017, the enemies on the third floor received a webtoon, viewable here: "Requiem For The Lost":/pools/16539

For a list of the enemies, see the [[List of Ragnarok Online Characters]].

h4. Examples

* !post #3225769
other_names: ROお絵かき生体工学研究所

title: trigram
body:
Eight diagrams used in Taoist cosmology to represent the fundamental principles of reality, seen as a range of eight interrelated concepts. Each consists of three lines, each line either "broken" or "unbroken," representing yin or yang, respectively. Due to their tripartite structure, they are often referred to as "trigrams" in English.

Most popularly used on [[Yakumo Yukari]]'s [[tabard]] on her [[Imperishable Night]] outfit, as well as [[Yagokoro Eirin]]'s dress.

h4. Examples

* !asset #20559401

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

body:

title: desert_dilemma_(meme)
body:
A thirsty man crawling through a desert and making a decision between two destinations written on different signs. One destination is noticeably farther away while the other is much closer. However, the man in the original comic chooses the farther away option, often 21 miles or 25 miles, as opposed to the closer one. Meme creators recaption what's written on the signs, as well as replace the man or the background, to depict someone making a poor decision.

h4. Origin

* !asset #21290256: Original comic

h4. External links

* "KnowYourMeme: Desert Dilemma":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/desert-dilemma

title: quadfold
body:
An insanely difficult [[contortion]] position in which the performer starts by laying on their stomach and bending their back until their thighs are parallel (or at least almost parallel) to the ground, effectively creating a knot out of their body. A variation of this position includes bending the knees to compress the performer even further.

Due to the tremendous amount of [[flexible|flexibility]] required to perform this position, it has never been confirmed whether it is humanly possible or if anyone has ever managed to achieve it. As of now, the performance of the quadfold remains fictional.

h4. Examples

* !post #7541545

title: folded_back
body:
A [[contortion]] pose (or at least a part of it), in which the performer bends their back backwards and squeezes it tightly in such a way that their upper back is touching their [[ass]]. The performers torso consequently forms a sort of "C" shape.

h4. Examples

* !post #7516903

title: zuihou_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Zuihou (kancolle)|]]'s Kai Ni forms.

She obtained her second remodels with the February 21, 2018 update with Kai Ni and Kai Ni- B forms.

Clothing-wise, she changed little, a lattice-patterned strap connected to both sleeves being the only real noticable change. Gear-wise, she gained a flight deck apron (complete with a "Dzuho" imprint, her real-life identification mark), her "mysterious" back gear has been rebuilt as less mysterious armoring with AA guns attached and her quiver as her flight deck. She now wields a full sized yumi. Similarly to Zuikaku's own second remodels, Kai2 is distinguished as keeping her camouflage color scheme (her muneate gained some landing guidance stripes in the process) and Kai Ni- B reverts to her original red-white color scheme.

Stats-wise, Kai Ni is a significant upgrade from kai, complete with medium range; while Kai Ni- B is a more expansive remodel that sacrifices plane slots and evasion for a larger upgrade (including the highest max AA amongst Light Carriers), ASW capabilities (weaker than Taiyou) and Long range. Both remodels are available at level 80.

title: ukulele_apology_video_(meme)
body:
An infamous "apology" video posted by YouTuber Colleen Ballinger (formerly known by her online persona [[Miranda Sings]]) in June 28th 2023 in which she addresses the then-recent controversy revolving around her allegedly "engaging with young fans in inappropriate ways":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/events/colleen-ballinger-and-adam-mcintyre-controversy.

The video came weeks after YouTuber Adam McIntyre shared his experiences of Ballinger purportedly having age-inappropriate conversations with him and various other young children in a group chat. Ballinger's decision to deliver her apology in the form of a [[ukulele]] song drew the ire of many internet commentators that believed the format to be too lighthearted to address the serious allegations levied against her, as well as trivializing the matters, prompting widespread backlash in the following days.

h4. Origin

* !asset #21209267: The video and it's like/dislike ratio as of May 2024

h4. See also

* [[Logan Paul's apology (meme)|]]

h4. External links

* "KnowYourMeme: Colleen Ballinger (Miranda Sings) Ukulele Apology Video":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/colleen-ballinger-miranda-sings-ukulele-apology-video
* "YouTube video":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ceKMnyMYIMo

title: tonari_no_seki-kun_junior
body:
A 2020 slice-of-life comedy manga spin-off of [[Tonari no Seki-kun]] by artist [[Morishige Takuma (morisiget)|]]. In it [[Yokoi Rumi]] has grown up and had a child ([[Makuru (Tonari no Seki-kun Junior)|]], whose father is implied to likely be [[Seki Toshinari]]). She interacts with her sons' antics in a very similar way to how she did with Seki in the original story.
 
h4. Characters

* [[Yokoi Rumi]]
* [[Makuru (Tonari no Seki-kun Junior)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Tonari no Seki-kun]] 

h4. External links

* "NicoNico Manga: Tonari no Seki-kun Junior":[https://manga.nicovideo.jp/comic/49576?track=verticalwatch_epinfo1]

title: tonari_no_seki-kun
body:
A 2010 slice-of-life comedy manga  by artist [[Morishige Takuma (morisiget)|]] later adapted into an anime in 2014. It features [[Seki Toshinari]] who is an eccentric highschool boy passes time coming up with strange games, jokes, pranks and the like to entertain himself during class, and [[Yokoi Rumi]], his female classmate, who sits at the desk next to him and reacts to his antics and attempts to reign him in. 

The manga has a 2020 spin-off called [[Tonari no Seki-kun Junior]] in which Rumi has grown up and had a child and engages in similar antics with her son (who's father is implied to likely be Seki).
 
h4. Characters

* [[Seki Toshinari]]
* [[Yokoi Rumi]]

h4. See also

* [[Tonari no Seki-kun Junior]]

title: playing_with_hair
body:
A character playing with either [[playing with own hair|their own hair]] or [[playing with another's hair|another's]] hair.

This is generally frivolous, playful, or meaningless behavior. For example they might be simply [[twirling hair|twirling]] or [[hair_flip|flipping]] a lock of hair, making a "[[hair mustache]]", or [[eating_hair|"eating"]], [[ruffling_hair|ruffling]], [[kissing_hair|kissing]] or [[smelling_hair|smelling]] their or another's hair.

If they are meaningfully working with their or another's hair for a concrete goal, instead use one of the following tags as appropriate:

* [[adjusting hair]]
* [[holding own hair]]
* [[tying hair]]
* [[brushing hair]]
* [[drying hair]]
* [[bunching hair]]
* [[cutting hair]]
* [[braiding hair]]
* [[washing hair]]
* [[brushing hair]]

title: rainbow_mika
body:
[b]"Rainbow" Mika Nanakawa[/b], or [b]"Rainbow" Mika[/b] ([b]レインボー・ミカ[/b]) or [b]R. Mika[/b] for short, is a video game character from the [[Street Fighter]] fighting game series. Her first appearance is in [[street_fighter_zero_(series)|Street Fighter Zero 3]], later re-appearing in [[Street Fighter V]].

Mika is a Japanese [[wrestling|professional wrestler]] trained by the big, domineering, shinai-sporting, golf cart-riding [[Harmageddon Yoko]]. One of her favorite attacks (outside of grappling) is a flying [[hip attack]]. She is usually seen with her tag-team partner [[Yamato Nadeshiko (Street Fighter)|]]. She is considered the forefront representative of "joshipuro" (Japanese women's pro wrestling) in fighting games. [[Zangief]], a fellow pro wrestler, is her hero.

Mika is most commonly seen wearing a white and sky blue [[wrestling outfit]] of some design, complete with a [[domino mask]] serving as a [[wrestling mask]] around her [[blue eyes]] and her [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]] done up as [[twintails]].

Mika's goal is to be "Star of the Ring." To try to accomplish this, Mika decided she would travel abroad and battle famous street fighters even before she made her official debut. During that time, she met Zangief, a wrestler she is a huge fan of. Zangief inspired her as a pro wrestler to train hard for the next time they meet.

title: workers'_party_of_korea_flag
body:
The [[flag]] of the Workers' Party of [[North Korea|Korea]] (shortened [b]WPK[/b]), the only ruling political party of North Korea. Use this tag when the flag and/or the logo is present in the image.

Its 3 symbols consist of a [[hammer]] (industrial workers), a short [[sickle]] (farmers) and the "samuwon" (a Korean [[calligraphy brush|ink brush]], used here to represent the clerks, traders, bureaucrats, professors, and writers).

h4. Examples

* !asset #23205893: WPK Flag: Logo against red background
* !asset #23205904: WPK Logo

title: hori-san_to_miyamura-kun
body:
Lit. [i]Hori-san and Miyamura-kun[/i]

A 4koma manga by [[hero_(dka)|HERO]], that was first published online in February 2007 and adapted into an OVA in 2011. The first bound volume was released in 2008 by Square Enix.

It was later adapted into [i]Horimiya[/i], a standard format manga by [[Hagiwara Daisuke]], serialized in Square Enix's [i]GFantasy[/i], which was later adapted into an anime by [[CloverWorks]] in Q1 2021.

[[Hori Kyouko]] is a flashy high school girl, who, despite her ostentatious appearance, excels in academics and has a family-loving character. [[Miyamura Izumi]] is a bland high school boy, who, despite not wanting to stand out in class, secretly wears piercings outside of school and has a large body tattoo. One day, Miyamura finds Hori's little brother injured and helps him back to Hori's house, where the relationship between Hori and Miyamura begins with Hori's discovery of Miyamura's secret.

h4. Characters

body:

Not to be confused with carrying bags that are actually [[brown bag|colored brown]].

title: a_second_plane_has_hit_the_x_(meme)
body:
[quote]
[i]"A second plane hit the second tower. America is under attack."[/i]
[/quote]
A [[meme]] based on a "photo":[https://rarehistoricalphotos.com/president-bush-informed-9-11-attack-photo] of [[George W. Bush]] being informed by White House Chief of Staff Andrew Card that a second plane had hit the [[World Trade Center]] on [[9/11]]. Bush was reading the children's book "The Pet Goat" in a classroom at the Emma E. Booker Elementary School in Sarasota, [[Florida (location)|]] when the photo was taken.

title: grim_(grim_adventures)
body: The Grim Reaper (or just Grim) is the titular main protagonist of the 2003 Cartoon Network animated TV series [[The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy]].

title: the_grim_adventures_of_billy_&_mandy
body: The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy is an American animated television series created by Maxwell Atoms for [[Cartoon Network]]. It follows [[billy (grim adventures)|Billy]], an extremely dimwitted, happy-go-lucky boy, and [[mandy (grim adventures)|Mandy]], a cynical, remorseless girl, who, after winning a limbo game to save Billy's pet hamster, gains Grim, the mighty [[Grim Reaper]], as their "best friend forever". Grim, who is reluctant to serve the two children, has access to supernatural items, spells, and other abilities that often lead Billy and Mandy to interact with otherworldly environments, characters, or situations.

title: kozaky
body: A demonic mad scientist [[Duel Monster]]. Uses a Motorcycle-Rider deck in his [[Yu-Gi-Oh! GX]] appearance. The creator of the Koaki Meiru archetype and [[Giant Kozaky]]. He's also good with cybernetics, as he's the one who turned [[Gagagigo]] into Giga Gagagigo and turned Charcoal Inpachi into Woodborg Inpachi.

title: blunt_bangs
body:
A hairstyle where the [[bangs]] are cut in a sharp, straight line across the entire length of the forehead. Mutually exclusive with [[swept bangs]] and [[asymmetrical bangs]].

Known in Japan as パッツン ([i]pattsun[/i]).

When combined with [[long hair]] and blunt [[sidelocks]], it becomes a type of [[hime cut]]. If the bangs are shaved or combed back at the temples, with the rest hanging loose at the forehead it may result in [[center-flap bangs]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7096351
* !post #7546725
* !post #6486803

h4. See also

* [[arched bangs]]
* [[blunt ends]]
* [[bangs]]
* [[swept bangs]] - For bangs loosely combed to one side
* [[parted bangs]] - For distinctly parted bangs
** [[double-parted bangs]]
* [[asymmetrical bangs]] - For bangs worn half combed back, half loose
* [[crossed bangs]] - For bangs that criss-cross each other on the forehead
* [[hair over eyes]] - For long bangs that cover the eyes
* [[hair over one eye]] - The same as the above, but asymmetric

title: blunt_tresses
body:
Hair that has been separated from the rest into [[sidelocks]], [[ringlets]], etc., and then been freshly cut flat. Typically tied with a [[tress ribbon]] or bunched together to create a tassel-like appearance. [[Akashi (kancolle)|Akashi]] from [[kantai collection|Kancolle]] is a prominent example of someone with these.

Not to be confused with [[blunt ends]], which refers to straight-cut hair in the back.

h4. Examples

* !post #8130294

h4. See also

* [[blunt bangs]]
* [[blunt ends]]

title: tress_ribbon
body:
A [[hair ribbon]] that is used only on a lock of hair. 

A "tress" is a long lock of hair, especially a long lock of women's hair. Archaically refers to a braid.

h4. Examples

* !post #1415
* !post #1439697
* !post #3143459

title: sagging_breasts
body:
When [[breasts]] have a noticeable sag to their shape, as opposed to the unnaturally perky breasts that are common in anime.

Not to be used for breasts that are simply [[hanging breasts|hanging]] freely due to the character [[bent over|bending over]] or [[leaning forward]].

Note that [[small breasts]] can also have a saggy appearance to them, although this is less common.

h4. Examples

title: shibari
body:
A type of elaborate Japanese [[rope]] [[bondage]]. Common features of shibari include intricate criss-crossed rope patterns tied around the body, ropes tied to apply pressure to a woman's breasts, and [[crotch rope]]s.

[b]Shibari[/b] is Japanese for "to tie", originally an art of tying rope around objects in a visually appealing way. In modern times, shibari is now used to describe stylized bondage. In this case, it refers to any of a variety of intricate body ties originating in Japan.  

h4. Examples

* !post #8077577
* !post #6650722

title: sparkle
body:
A momentary bright shimmer of reflected [[light]], generally [[diamond_(shape)|]]- or [[star (symbol)|]]-shaped, and short-lived. Groups of them tend to appear and vanish in various instances.

[b]Sparkle[/b], [[glint]], and [[diffraction spikes]] all refer to similar patterns of bright lines radiating from a point. They are not clearly differentiated, and usage tends to be context-sensitive. In general:
* [b]Sparkle[/b] is considered the base case. Usually four lines at right angles radiating from a point. Associated with eyes, liquid or particulate matter (e.g. raindrops, snow, sand), or nothing (appearing mid-air). Can appear in large numbers.
* [[Glint]] is associated with solid objects, especially ones which are metallic and/or sharp. Usually appear singly or in small numbers.
* [[Diffraction spikes]] is the technical term for the phenomenon in general, but is used less often. Can be used for more realistic-looking effects or conversely when appearing extremely large and exaggerated. More likely than sparkle and glint to be asymmetric or to have more than four radiating lines.

h4. See also

* [[sparkling aura]] for multiple sparkles around a certain object or character. 
* [[iridescent]]
* [[lens flare]]
* [[bokeh]]
* [[light particles]]

title: maple_syrup
body:
A type of [[syrup]] made from the sap of maple trees. Popularly poured on [[pancake]]s and [[waffle]]s, and often associated with [[Canada]] due to the syrup being first made by the indigenous peoples of North America. The maple trees need to grow in colder climates for them to produce the sap, and Canada is the northernmost country of the continent, along with the [[maple leaf]] being seen on the [[Canadian flag]].

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: honey
body:
A sweet substance that is exclusively produced by [[bee|honey bees]] using nectar from flowers. It is widely used for sweetening foods, for flavoring, and for medicinal properties. 

Honey is one of the few foods in the world that in its raw state will never spoil if properly stored, this is due to honey's low water content, high acidity, and it containing small amounts hydrogen peroxide.

h4.See also

* [[Honeypot]]
* [[Honey dipper]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: owl
body:
A nocturnal [[bird]] of prey from the order "Strigiformes":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Owl]. About a third of all species have tufts of feathers on their heads colloquially known as "ears," which play no role in hearing but instead are used for display and communication.

h4. See also
* [[Barn Owl]]
* [[Burrowing Owl]]
* [[Potoo]] (not closely related, but looks similar)
* [[Snowy Owl]]
* [[Southern Boobook]]
* [[Tag Group:Birds]]

title: air_jordan
body:
Air Jordan is an American sportswear brand owned by [[Nike (company)|]], originally created in collaboration with [[Michael Jordan]]. The line first launched in 1984, with the first release of the [[Air Jordan 1]] basketball [[sneakers|sneaker]], and has since expanded to feature a new numbered sneaker model every year, as well as other kinds of apparel and accessories.

Rereleases of numbered models are given the "Retro" subtitle, but otherwise retain the same design as their original releases.

title: no_bitches?_(meme)
body:
A meme spawned from a screenshot from the film [[megamind_(movie)|Megamind]], in which the [[megamind|titular character]] glares into a peephole with an expectant expression. In 2021, it was paired with the phrase "no bitches?", implying the viewer's status of having no lovers to call upon is something that disappoints Megamind greatly.

The trend of drawing different characters with the expression arguably began with [[monotone ink]]'s "version":[/posts/5150477], depicting [[melina (elden ring) |Melina]] from the at-the-time recently released [[Elden Ring]]. 

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: No Bitches?":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/no-bitches]

title: nah_i'd_win_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from a panel of [[Jujutsu Kaisen]] Chapter 221.

The panel features [[Gojou Satoru]] saying the phrase "Nah, I'd win." as a callback to his response when [[Itadori Yuuji]] asked him if he would lose against [[Ryoumen Sukuna (Jujutsu Kaisen)|Ryoumen Sukuna]] in Chapter 3. The panel exploded in popularity in late 2023 after Chapter 236 released because [spoiler]he would, in fact, not win.[/spoiler]

* !post #6951546
* !post #7422459

title: ultra_sword_kirby
body:
One of the Super Abilities used by [[Kirby]] in [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]] and its [[kirby's return to dream land deluxe|remake]].
It also appears in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series as a [[Final Smash]].

It allows Kirby to use a [[huge_weapon|large sword]] in the form of the titular [[ultra sword]], or a similar object to defeat enemies and destroy certain parts of the terrain. 

Multiple variations can appear:
* a sword with a [[star (symbol)|]] on its handle (the aforementioned titular ultra sword)
* a [[shinai]]
* [[Meta Knight]]'s [[Galaxia (sword)|]]
* a [[cleaver]]
* a golden [[hand fan]]
* a [[cutlass]]
* a [[tuna]]
* [[Gigant Edge]]'s sword (introduced in the remake)
* [[Morpho Knight]]'s sword (introduced in the remake)

h4. External links
* "WiKirby: Ultra Sword":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Ultra_Sword

title: japan-korea_yuri_(meme)
body:
A chain of popular tweets began with Japanese and Korean women warning each other about the dangers of dating men from their respective countries and commiserating.  When one user suggested that "Japanese and Korean women should just date each other,":https://x.com/aupfmvv/status/1826826493559013716 artists quickly began to draw Korean woman x Japanese woman [[yuri]].  

The "Korean woman" is typically drawn with black hair and very confident and assertive, while the "Japanese woman" is typically drawn as a brown-haired, nervous, blushing mess.  Sometimes a Chinese woman gets thrown in as well (e.g. post #8047719, post #8048076).

Some Japanese women have tweeted stories about dating or flirting with Korean women (and vice versa) which have been drawn (e.g. post #8048084, post #8048092).

Since becoming popular, it has also spawned spinoffs involving other countries.
