Titular character of [[Kuroshitsuji]].
The current human guise of a demon contracted to [[Ciel Phantomhive]], acting as his hyper-competent [[butler]]. After Ciel finds and gets revenge on the people who murdered his parents, their contract is complete and Sebastian will eat his soul.
other_names: セバスチャン・ミカエリス

title: ciel_phantomhive
body:
The protagonist of [[Kuroshitsuji]].
The young heir and the son of the late Phantomhive household. He makes a contract with a [[Sebastian Michaelis|demon]] in exchange for his life and escape from a cult sacrifice, and henceforth becomes a pragmatic and cool operator. 

[spoiler] His name isn't actually Ciel. That was his older twin brother's name, and this Ciel usurped his identity after the former was sacrificed. [/spoiler]
other_names: シエル・ファントムハイヴ

title: x-wing
body:
A catchall for the [[T-65 X-wing]] and later [[T-70 X-wing]] starfighters used by the Rebel Alliance and Resistance respectively in the [[Star Wars]] series.
It made its theatrical debut, as the T-65B model, in [[star wars: a new hope|Star Wars (1977)]] as the spacecraft piloted by [[Luke Skywalker]] and the Red Squadron when Luke destroyed the [[Death Star]].

title: iphone
body:
A line of [[smartphone]]s created by [[Apple Inc.]] using Apple's [[iOS (os)|]] operating system. The first-generation iPhone was announced by [[Steve Jobs]] on January 9, 2007. Since then Apple has annually released new iPhone models and iOS updates.

If it's tablet-sized, it's an [[iPad]]. It might also be an [[iPod Touch]].

Anything that looks like a smartphone with a circular home button is probably an iPhone.
iPhone 5 and later have the headphone jack on the bottom of the device instead of the top, like an [[iPod touch]].
iPhone 7 and later have no headphone jack.
[[iPhone X]] and later have no home button.

h4. Tagged Models

* [[iPhone (first generation)]]

title: the_fast_and_the_furious:_tokyo_drift
body:
The third film in [[Fast & Furious]] saga, released in 2006. The film follows [[Sean Boswell]], a hot-headed American high schooler who gets sent to live with his father in [[Tokyo (city)|]] after a street racing wreck, and discovers the local [[drifting]] scene.

Tokyo Drift is largely credited for creating an increased interest in drifting and Japanese cars in America, and the movie's theme song (performed by Japanese rap group Teriyaki Boyz) is often used in [[meme]]s and edits about drifting to this day. Notable cars featured in the film include [[Han Lue|Han]]'s [[Veilside]] [[mazda rx-7 fd|FD RX-7]], Sean's [[Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution]], and the "Mona Lisa" [[Nissan Silvia S15]]. The film is also notable for real life drift legend [[Tsuchiya Keiichi]]'s involvement, as he was the stunt coordinator and one of the stunt drivers.

This entry is known as [b]Wild Speed X3 Tokyo Drift[/b] in Japan.

body:

title: nissan_silvia_s14
body: The 6th generation of the [[Nissan Silvia]], sold from 1993-1998 in Japan and 1994-2000 in foreign markets. Sold as the Nissan 240SX in America.

title: nissan_onevia
body:
A custom version of the [[Nissan Silvia S13]] which replaces the front end with that of a [[Nissan 180SX]], essentially forming the inverse of the more popular [[Nissan Sileighty]] and replicating the appearance of the US market's S13 240SX.

Unlike the Sileighty, the Onevia custom model has never been officially recognized by Nissan.

title: nissan_silvia_s13
body:
The fifth generation of the [[Nissan Silvia]], produced from 1988 to 1994. It shared a platform with the [[Nissan 180sx|180SX]], which led to popular modifications like the [[Nissan Sileighty|Sileighty]] and [[Nissan Onevia|Onevia]], which swapped parts of the two models.

The S13 was sold in America as the 240SX, though it featured the 180SX's front end with pop-up headlights instead of the original Silva front-end.

body: The fourth generation of the [[Nissan Silvia]], produced from 1983 to 1988. Known as the [b]Nissan 200SX[/b] in the US and the [b]Nissan Gazelle[/b] in Australia.

title: opa-opa
body:
[b]Opa-Opa[/b] is a fictional sentient [[robot]] /[[spacecraft]] [[mecha]] from the [[Fantasy Zone]] [[video game]] series by [[SEGA]] Corporation.

It is a small egg-shaped robot ship with two legs and wings. Its form resembles a [[chibi|superdeformed]] mecha in [[Gerwalk]] mode.

Opa-Opa became [[Sega]]'s mascot from 1985 until 1987, when it was replaced by [[Alex Kidd (character)|]].

He also appears in the anime [[Akai Koudan Zillion]] and its [[video game]] adaptations for the [[Sega Master System]] [[game console]].

title: e-100
body:
A prototype German superheavy tank, intended to be a more standardized version of the Maus. Only its hull was ever completed, though a proposal for its turret existed but failed to materialize. It was supposed to be the largest and most powerful tank in the E-Series, armed with a 128mm gun.

title: fall_guys
body:
A platformer battle royale game developed by Mediatonic and published by Devolver Digital, released for [[computer|PC]] and [[PlayStation 4]] in 2020. It quickly became one of the most talked about games of the year, partially due to its popularity among streamers and [[virtual youtuber]]s. It is partially inspired by Japanese game shows, particularly [i][[Takeshi's Castle]][/i].

title: joan_(animal_crossing)
body:
A [[boar]] from the [[Animal Crossing]] franchise. She visits the player's island every Sunday to sell [[Turnip]]s. Her role is replaced by her granddaughter [[Daisy Mae (animal crossing)|]] in [i]New Horizons[/i].
She wears a [[blue kimono|blue]] [[kimono]] with an [[igeta (pattern)|]] pattern, a white [[headscarf]], and carries a [[basket]] of turnips on her back. She has a pair of white tusks and her pupils are shaped like [[star-shaped pupils|stars]].

title: epiphaneia_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Named after the day of the Epiphany. This is a reference to her dam's name origins as a reference to Shakespeare's "[i]Twelfth Night[/i]".[/tn]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Symboli Kris S (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Cesario (racehorse)|]].

He is famous as the winner of the 2013 Kikuka Sho and the 2014 Japan Cup. He is also famous as a successful sire in his own right, being the sire of a Triple Tiara with [[Daring Tact (racehorse)|]].

title: barbara_(genshin_impact)
body: A playable Hydro character in [[Genshin Impact]]; her full name is Barbara Pegg. [quote]"The Deaconess of the Favonius Church and a shining starlet adored by all. Although the concept of a starlet is rather novel in a city of bards, the people of Mondstadt love Barbara nonetheless."[/quote] Barbara has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], styled into [[twin drills]]. She wears a [[white dress]] with a [[detached collar]], as well as [[detached sleeves|detached]], [[puffy long sleeves|puffy sleeves]]. For legwear, she wears [[white pantyhose]] and [[fold-over boots]]. Her older sister is [[Jean (Genshin Impact)|Jean]], the Acting Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius. She is voiced by [[Kitou Akari]] (Japanese) and [[Laura Stahl]] (English). h4. Official Costumes * !post #4117035: Default * !post #5027300: [[barbara_(summertime_sparkle)_(genshin_impact)|Summertime Sparkle]] * !post #7899698: [[barbara_(pizza_alvolo)_(genshin_impact)|Pizza Alvolo]] h4. See also * [[List of Genshin Impact characters]] h4. External links * "Genshin Impact Wiki: Barbara":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Barbara]

title: ultraman_zero_beyond
body:
Ultraman Zero Beyond is a form featured in [[Ultraman Geed (series)|]] that is accessed through the Riser (Zero Mode) which uses assets of the New Generation Ultra Warriors ([[Ultraman Ginga|Ginga]], [[Ultraman Victory|Victory]], [[Ultraman X|X]], and [[Ultraman Orb|Orb]]). It is stated to be [[Ultraman Zero|Zero]]'s most powerful form. This form debuts in episode 8.

In this form, Zero traded his Protector for Crystals shaped after Orb's Protectors and his face resembles the Riser (Zero Mode).

In Ultraman Hit Song History New Generation, rather than a Fusion Rise, Zero is able to achieve this form by physically fusing with its four components. It is unknown whether this version of Zero Beyond is any more powerful than the normal one.
other_names: ウルトラマンゼロビヨンド

title: chuseok
body:
Chuseok , also known as Hangawi (from archaic Korean for "the great middle (of autumn)"), is a major mid-autumn harvest festival and a three-day holiday in South Korea celebrated on the 15th day of the 8th month of the lunar calendar on the full moon. In North Korea, they only celebrate for the day of chuseok. Like many other harvest festivals around the world, it is held around the autumn equinox, i.e. at the very end of summer or in early autumn. It is the biggest traditional holiday in South Korea.

h4. See also

* [[Mid-Autumn Festival]] [tn]Chinese equivalent[/tn]
* [[Tsukimi]] [tn]Japanese equivalent[/tn]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Chuseok":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuseok

title: james_earl_jones
body:
James Earl Jones (January 17, 1931 – September 9, 2024) was an American actor. A pioneer for black actors in the entertainment industry, he is known for his extensive and acclaimed roles on stage and screen. He is one of the few performers to achieve the EGOT (Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony).
Jones made his film debut in [[Stanley Kubrick|Stanley Kubrick's]] [[Dr. Strangelove]] (1964). He received a Golden Globe Award nomination for Claudine (1974). Jones gained international fame for his voice role as [[Darth Vader]] in the [[Star Wars]] franchise, beginning with the original 1977 film. Jones's other notable films include The Man (1972), [[Conan the Barbarian]] (1982), and [[The Lion King]] (1994).

title: date_pun
body:
A [[number pun]] based on a particular date.

November is notorious for having a lot of these because "11" resembles イイ (good/great). For example, November 29th is "[[good meat day]]" (ii niku no hi) because two (ni) and nine (ku) sounds like meat (niku).

title: sankaku_no_kyori_wa_kagirinai_zero
body:
An ongoing light novel series written by Misaki Saginomiya and illustrated by [[Hiten (hitenkei)|]]. It began publishing in May 2018. The series follows Shiki Yano and his encounter with his classmate, [[Minase Akiha]], a girl with a split-personality disorder. There is a manga adaptation that began publishing in April 2019 & ended November 2020 with illustrations by [[Taromarun]].

English Title: Bizarre Love Triangle

title: high_contrast
body:
A picture that features very dark colors besides very light colors. More commonly seen on [[greyscale]] arts, but it can also be seen of coloful ones such as post #137122.

Try to look for broad ink-like strokes, pitch black shadowing, solid black and white.

These are often results of [[flat color]] (post #5538857) or [[comic|manga]]-like coloring (post #5782342), [[halftone]] may be present too (post #5892760). Compare post #5785450, which despite having very dark hair, has enough shading to give it more gradient and volume.

Not to be confused with [[spot color]] or [[color contrast]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7035965

h4. See also

* [[flat color]]
* [[Tag Group:Colors]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: critter_pick_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A [[Honkai: Star Rail]] event that features various critters that look like [[cat]]s fused with [[mooncake]]s; a lot of which are based of pre-existing characters. They were originally created by [[Ruan Mei (Honkai: Star Rail)|Ruan Mei]].

(This tag is intended for the critters themselves, but as they are not collectively named beyond simply being called "Ruan Mei's Creations" (a term shared with another species of critters resembling dumplings), the tag takes its name after the event for the time being. It should likely be renamed once their species name is clarified)

h4. See also

title: divided_highway
body:
A divided highway (NA) or dual carriageway (UK) is a [[highway]] with a divider between the lanes going in opposite directions.  This divider may be a physical barrier, such as a strip of land or a concrete barrier, or it might be an empty lane with clear markings to indicate it's a divider (typically found only in rural areas with low traffic).

h4. See also

* [[Elevated highway]]
* [[Multi-lane road]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dual carriageway":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dual_carriageway]

title: model_clipping
body: When part of a 3D model goes through another part or another object when it's not supposed to, such as hair going through the shoulder. Clipping can also occur with the camera when it moves too close to a model, allowing the model to be seen from the inside.

title: thobe
body:
Thawb or thobe (Arabic: ثَوْب) is an [[Arabian clothes|Arab]] men's garment. It is a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] ankle-length traditional [[robe]]—often light-colored. It is mainly worn in the Arabian Peninsula, the Levant, North Africa, and some countries in East and West Africa.

title: cooler_(fifth_form)_(dragon_ball)
body:
[[Cooler (Dragon Ball)|]]'s exclusive form, first appearing in [[Dragon Ball Z]] Movie 5, also known as [b]Fourth Transformation[/b] (第４変身) and Cooler's Final Form. Unlike the previous forms in the [[Frieza Clan]] (which either suppress their power of their real form, or is their real form in their Fourth and usually Final Form), his Fifth Form was a power-up similar to the [[Super Saiyan]] forms. The body changes include a growth in height, gaining spike protrusions and additional gem-like parts, natural [[red eyes]] becoming fully colored and [[no pupils|pupil-less]], and the inclusion of a [[mouth mask]].

In [[Dragon Ball Heroes]], Cooler would take advantage of his brother's [[Golden Frieza|Golden]] transformation and combine it with his fifth form to become [[Golden Cooler]].

title: iruma_miu
body:
Character from [i][[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]][/i].

The Ultimate Inventor. Likes to experiment with new gadgets, but has disowned her most well known invention, "Eye-drop Contacts", after selling it off. She is a rude, crass girl until someone responds in turn, which causes her to back down almost immediately.

Wears a pink [[serafuku]] with [[goggles]] [[goggles_on_head|on her head]]. She wears a [[black choker]] and smaller [[barbed wire]] necklaces. She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and a [[large_breasts|prominent bust]].

She is often depicted with a [[Niko Niko Happy]] mouse mascot.

body:
Chick-fil-A is a large American fast food restaurant chain.  They specialize in [[chicken sandwich|chicken sandwiches]].  A popular item on their menu is their [[waffle fries]]. Due to its late founder's Southern Baptist Christian beliefs, it is company policy for all restaurants nationwide to be closed on Sundays.

title: haguro_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Haguro[/i]. Character design by [[Ootsuki Momiji]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a [[side ponytail]], and [[red eyes]]. In line with the class being portrayed as schoolgirls, she wears a black [[serafuku]] [[crop top]] and a long [[black skirt]]. She also wears black [[platform boots]], [[black belt]], [[mismatched legwear]] where it is a [[single kneehigh]] on her right and [[fishnet socks|fishnet]] on her left, [[black choker]], a crow [[mask]], and torn [[black gloves]].

Her rigging consists of four out of five historical 203 mm twin mounts on two separate hull pieces, one mount of 610 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her left, and a [[tantou]] sidearm.

title: bad_omens_(band)
body:
Bad Omens is an American Metalcore band formed in 2015 who bears artistic influence from [[Bring Me The Horizon]] [i]et al,[/i] according to an interview in 2016 by Alternative Press. The band rose to popularity with their 2022 song "Just Pretend" from their album "The Death of Peace of Mind". Currently consists of frontman & lead vocalist Noah Sebastian; bassist Nicholas Ruffilo; guitarist, programmer & backing vocalist Joakim Karlsson and drummer Nick Folio, the band received positive recognition by Bring Me The Horizon and became the supporting act in the latter's tour in January 2024.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bad Omens":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bad_Omens

title: bird_of_paradise_flower
body:
[i][b]Strelitzia[/b][/i] (commonly known as bird of paradise or crane flower) is a genus of five flowering plants in the family [i]Strelitziaceae[/i] native to the southern Africa. Its common name, [i]bird of paradise[/i], refers to the resemblance of the open flower to the head of an actual [[bird of paradise (bird)|]].

Bird of paradise produces exotic looking flowers, usually in shades of red, orange or yellow ([i]Strelitzia reginae[/i], [i]S. juncea[/i]), although some species are white ([i]Strelitzia alba[/i], [i]S. caudata[/i], [i]S. nicolai[/i]). Each flower sprouts from a beak-like sheath (called a spathe) that grows at right angles to the stem, creating the appearance of the bird's beak. The flowers consist of red to yellow sepals and purplish-blue or white petals. The leaves are tall and thick, arranged in a fan-like pattern.

h4. Examples
* !asset #21573012: Photo reference
* !asset #21572458
* !post #4215027

h4. See also
* [[Heliconia]], also known as [i]false bird of paradise[/i]
* [[Red ginger (flower)|]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Strelitzia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strelitzia
* "Wikipedia: Strelitzia reginae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strelitzia_reginae
* "Wikipedia: Strelitziaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strelitziaceae

title: bring_me_the_horizon
body:
Bring Me the Horizon (often abbreviated as BMTH) are a British rock band formed in Sheffield in 2004. The band is best known for their metalcore songs and their influence on the subgenre, although the band started out as a deathcore band with the release of their debut EP "This Is What The Edge Of Your Seat Was Made For" and debut album "Count Your Blessings"; and delved into nu-metal with the release of their sixth album "[[Amo (bring me the horizon)|]]", and returned to their aggressive roots with their EP "Post Human: Nex Gen", surprise-released on 24th May 2024. The band has collaborated with numerous other acts such as Lights, Ed Sheeran, SLANDER, Spiritbox, AURORA, Underoath and so on, and had won many awards including [i]Kerrang![/i] Awards, BRIT Awards, Alternative Press and nominated for Grammy Awards on various categories.

In the end of 2023, the band announced one of their member Jordan Fish leaving the band. Fish first worked with the band to assist the existing members to complete the band's fourth album "Sempiternal", with his notable work being "Can You Feel My Heart":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QJJYpsA5tv8] from the album been widely used in the [[gigachad_(meme)|]] [[meme]]. The song became the most well-known song of the band as the result of the meme.

h4. References

* "Wikipedia: Bring Me The Horizon":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bring_Me_the_Horizon]
* "[i]Kerrang![/i]: Bring Me The Horizon Part Ways with Jordan Fish":[https://www.kerrang.com/amp/bring-me-the-horizon-part-ways-with-jordan-fish]
* "KnowYourMeme: Gigachad":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/gigachad]

title: power_rangers:_legacy_wars
body:
Power Rangers: Legacy Wars is a mobile video game released to tie-in to the 2017 movie. Power Rangers Legacy Wars is a cross-series mashup of various Ranger teams, villains and monsters where players can team up with or battle other users online. It was announced at San Diego Comic Con in July 2017 that the app had surpassed 18 million downloads.

Beginning with an update on May 17th 2018, characters from the [[Street Fighter]] franchise are incorporated into the game.

On July 19th, a teaser trailer for a short movie called Power Rangers Legacy Wars - Street Fighter Showdown was released celebrating the two franchises and the release of the brand new fusion Ranger "[[Crimson Hawk Ranger]]".

title: outside_border
body:
When a character or object appears either on top of or outside a [[border]], [[letterboxed|letterbox]] or [[pillarboxed|pillarbox]] surrounding the rest of an image or panel. Do not use with text of any kind.

Not to be confused with [[out of frame]], which is when the physical presence of an individual is almost entirely absent from the image.

h4. Examples

* !post #8079825: [[White border]]
* !post #8072847: [[Pillarboxed]]
* !post #8077369: [[Letterboxed]]
* !post #7584811: [[Comic]]

h4. See also

* [[fourth wall]]
* [[column lineup background]]

title: todesritter
body:
A fictional manned military giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It was introduced in the [[video game]] Mobile Suit [[Gundam Side Story: Missing Link]].

[b]AMX-018[HADES] Todesritter[/b]

A heavily customized high performance [[mobile suit]] first deployed by [[Neo Zeon]] in U.C. 0090. It was made from the wreckage of the [[pale_rider_(mobile_suit)|RX-80PR Pale Rider]] with assistance from [[Anaheim Electronics]].

title: after_10000_years_i'm_free_(meme)
body:
"Ahh! After ten thousand years, I'm free! It's time to conquer Earth!"

The most famous line of [[witch bandora|Rita Repulsa]] when emerging from her dumpster in [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] Season 1's opening.

h4. External links

* "YouTube: Ahh After 10,000 years I'm free! Time to conquer Earth!":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HkpS2Sdu2io]

title: daijinryuu
body:
A sentient mechanical dragon god that appears as a neutral antagonist in [[Gosei Sentai Dairanger]].

His counterpart in [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] is [b]Serpentera[/b], a giant personal Zord of [[Lord Zedd]], and is co-piloted by [[grifforzer|Goldar]].

It is the most massive Zord ever created; the skycraper-sized Red Dragon Thunderzord is roughly the size of its hand. It resembles an Eastern Dragon in form, and has enough power to annihilate a planet. It attacks by firing out bolts of energy, and its colossal size allows to crush nearly any foe, although Tor the Shuttlezord could withstand it, if only barely. Its massive power brought the Power Rangers to the brink of defeat every time that it was called, and it failed to destroy them only because of its one weakness: the colossal amount of fuel that it needed to be powered.

title: jschlatt
body:
A YouTuber and Twitch streamer who rose to popularity through the [[SMPLive]] server. He would later play on [[Dream SMP]] and [[Origins SMP]], and eventually create the SDMP. Formerly a member of the group Lunch Club.

Often portrayed wearing a business [[suit]] with a [[red necktie]], and with [[sheep ears]] and [[sheep horns]].

title: kidou_keisatsu_patlabor
body:
[i][b]Patlabor[/b][/i] (a portmanteau of "patrol" and "labor"), also known as [i][b]Mobile Police Patlabor[/b][/i] (機動警察パトレイバー), is an anime and manga [[science fiction]] franchise created in 1988 by "Headgear", a group consisting of manga artist [[Yuuki Masami]], director Oshii Mamoru, screenwriter Itō Kazunori, mecha designer [[Izubuchi Yutaka]], and character designer [[Takada Akemi]]. 

Patlabor is set in a near future [[Japan]], and it chronicles the exploits of a metropolitan [[police]] unit equipped with patrol [[mecha]]s called "Patlabors". 

The franchise includes a manga, a TV series, two OVA series, three feature-length movies, two light novel series, and a short film compilation, named [i][b]Minipato[/b][/i] (ミニパト) because of its [[chibi]] drawing style.

The original manga received the 36th Shogakukan Manga Award for shōnen in 1991.

title: shogo:_mobile_armor_division
body: [b]Shogo: Mobile Armor Division[/b] is a First Person Shooter PC game made and published by Monolith Productions in 1998. The game is heavily inspired by 1980s/1990s Mecha anime like [[Appleseed]] and [[Kidou Keisatsu Patlabor]] as the player can pilot four different Mechs of your choice.

title: yumekawa_yui
body:
Protagonist of [[Idol Time Pripara]]. [[Yumekawa Shogo]]'s sister. As her name suggests, she is based on [[yume kawaii]].

Yui has [[purple eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[curly hair|curls]], [[sidelocks]] and [[two side up]] [[ringlets]]. She decorates her hair with a [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow|bow]] with a [[star hair ornament|star]] in the middle and usually wears [[Avocado Academy school uniform]].

While inside PriPara, Yui grows taller and her hair [[long hair|reaches down until her waist]]. Her usual outfit consists of a [[purple choker|purple]] [[star choker]], a [[star necklace]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[pink jacket]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[purple shirt]] with a [[heart print|heart]] [[print shirt|print]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[purple skirt|purple]] [[miniskirt]] with [[frilled skirt|frills]] on the bottom, [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]] and [[purple footwear|purple]] [[shoes]] decorated with a [[pink bow]].

Alternate universe counterpart: [[Gekikawa Yui]] from [i][[Kiratto Pri Chan]][/i] of [[Pretty Series|the same franchise]].

Voiced by Date Arisa.
